channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 inquiry gets international backing at World Health Assembly as Daniel Andrews spruiks $2.7b Victoria recovery package, nation's death toll at 99

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide has almost reached 4.7 million.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Premier announces $2.7 billion construction package, McDonald's shuts a dozen Victorian restaurants

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: In a major strategic victory for Australia, more than 100 countries are set to co-sponsor a key motion calling for an independent inquiry into the coronavirus.
item.title: Global independent inquiry into the coronavirus set to pass

item.description: The AFL's decision to put fierce foes Port Adelaide and Adelaide in the same hotel hub makes little sense, Power coach Ken Hinkley says.
item.title: 'It doesn't make a lot of sense': Port not happy to share resort with Crows

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police believed the body is linked to a 12-metre yacht found washed up at Mooloolaba about 8am, with a second search under way for a missing fisherman.
item.title: Body discovered during search for two missing off Sunshine Coast

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: The GWS Giants started life in the AFL with four playing assistant coaches, and their oldest player is expecting COVID-19 could bring that dual role back.
item.title: Giant throwback: Shaw sees future for player-coaches in new AFL order

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: As WA has taken its first tentative steps under the new phase of COVID-19 restrictions, Premier Mark McGowan has confirmed another day of no new coronavirus cases in the state.
item.title: 'Time to shine': WA cautiously opens up as state records no new cases overnight

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The woman took her casual employer, Village Roadshow Theme Parks, to the Fair Work Commission.
item.title: Queensland woman loses bid to keep annual leave under JobKeeper

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: A quarter of firearm thefts occurred in Queensland, a report looking into statistics from 2018 reveal.
item.title: Stolen firearms incidents shift from cities to rural communities

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: The news, entertainment and lifestyle website will be shuttered on Friday.
item.title: Network 10 to close 10 Daily website

item.description: John Millman has defended Dominic Thiem after the world No.3 refused to help fund lower-ranked tennis players struggling during the coronavirus shutdown.
item.title: It's not up to tennis aces to lessen pay gap: Millman

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: police break up weekend parties and authorities investigate COVID-19 case in Rockhampton

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: A Queensland man will remain behind bars in NSW for at least another day before possible extradition to the Sunshine State over his parents' deaths.
item.title: Alleged Qld parent killer facing extradition after NSW bail denied

item.description: Mason Fletcher, the son of 400-game AFL legend Dustin Fletcher, is among a group of Australian and Kiwi talent snapped up by powerhouse US football colleges seeking punting talent.
item.title: Dustin Fletcher's son among Aussies signed by US colleges as punters

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: The toddlers were pulled from a home in Batlow, in the state's Snowy Mountains region, and could not be resuscitated.
item.title: Twin three-year-old girls die in house fire

item.description: The US president said ideally golf tournament crowds would be "standing on top of each other" as they did before the pandemic, which has killed around 90,000 Americans.
item.title: Trump says return of sports essential for country's 'psyche'

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The Souths star told police he received a call from someone threatening to release the footage unless he paid $20,000.
item.title: Police investigate after footage emerges of fight linked to alleged blackmail of Cody Walker

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Market Wrap
item.title: Market wrap: all the leasing and sales activity in and around Sydney

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: Most local governments have geared up their recreation and pool facilities to open this week, but some are calling it impossible.
item.title: WA councils divided over pool re-openings, with swimming lessons still a distant target

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: A woman allegedly tried to help the male driver remove the cash, drugs and other items from the car before police arrived.
item.title: Police allegedly find $168,000 in cash, drugs in crashed BMW on Gold Coast

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: WA's biggest pork producer is still struggling to control pollution at its Pinjarra site after COVID-19-related delays, but pushes ahead with expansion plans.
item.title: ‘Vile’: Alarm at boar stud proposal as Pinjarra piggery sparks fresh complaint

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: The announcement and teaser come as calls build for the state government to support the struggling property sector, one of the state's biggest employers.
item.title: Civic Heart back on the agenda as Perth's biggest developer flags announcement

item.description: Workers accustomed to a firmer divide between work and other activities might be in for a shock as the workplace encroaches on home life.
item.title: Work from home is fine ... for now

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: As of midnight, WA lifted some of the restrictions that have seen the number of active infections drop to next to nothing, but also destroy the state's economy.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Just three active cases in the state as restrictions begin to ease

item.description: Socceroos coach Graham Arnold says he has a core of 45 players he now trusts to get Australia to a fifth straight FIFA World Cup in 2022.
item.title: Arnold backs newfound depth to get Socceroos to Qatar

item.description: Premier League players are due to report back to work this week with their club's training grounds transformed into "sterile bubbles".
item.title: Premier League players will return to train in 'sterile bubbles'

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: New allegations of misconduct have been levelled at St Andrew’s College after a landmark review had recommended cultural change.
item.title: New allegations of student misconduct at University of Sydney college

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Geelong recruit Jack Steven is in recovery from surgery to repair a stab wound that is the focus of a police investigation.
item.title: Jack Steven recovering from surgery

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Izack Rodda, Isaac Lucas and Harry Hockings were told by the Queensland Reds not to bother arriving for training on Monday after refusing to accept pay cuts.
item.title: 'These situations are unprecedented': Super Rugby trio stood down

item.description: When Sydney tattoo artist Marcela Menga posted her picture of a client’s French bulldog online, she did not anticipate the flurry of pet portrait requests that would follow, or the lifeline they would provide.
item.title: Tattoo artists turn to pet projects during crisis

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Federal Court Justice Geoffrey Flick found it would not make sense for stood-down workers to get sick leave because they were not at work to begin with.
item.title: Stood-down Qantas workers lose bid to use sick leave in test case

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Keith Jarrett's brilliant trio stretched standards beyond recognition.
item.title: Giving a song a long goodbye

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Neither of Sydney's teams know who they'll be playing against when the AFL season resumes on June 11, but their preparations took a big step forward on Monday.
item.title: 'A step towards normality': Swans, Giants return to group training

item.description: "COVID-19 has caused some unusual and unprecedented travel patterns," Stats NZ senior demographer Kim Dunstan said.
item.title: Pandemic thought to have pushed New Zealand's population up to five million

item.description: Eight new cases in Victoria as pedestrians slowly return to CBD.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The 31-year-old was stopped while driving south on the M1 in Sydney's northern suburbs, about four hours after the bodies were discovered north of Brisbane.
item.title: Son charged in NSW after slain parents found in Qld bed and breakfast

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The US is playing a dangerous game as it seeks new pressure points to demonstrate how tough it is on China.
item.title: Trump is threatening the global financial system as he looks to punish China

item.description: Research is discovering that there are things we can do ourselves to boost brain health. Building muscle with exercise is one and a healthier diet is another.
item.title: What processed foods actually do to your brain

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Weekend deaths of Geordie Jenkinson, 10, and Taylah Pearson, 22, take the number of quad bike fatalities in 2020 to eight, already equal to last year's total.
item.title: Twin tragedies shine spotlight on dangers of quad bikes

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Damien Hardwick says this year's unusual circumstances mean 2020 premiers will be remembered forever.
item.title: The 2020 premiership will be one of the greatest flag wins: Hardwick

item.description: Latest purchase means Facebook will have another route into competitor's apps.
item.title: Facebook's Giphy acquisition further extends social giant's reach

item.description: After receiving an update on her doping appeal hearing, Shayna Jack has vowed to clear her name and return to the Australian swimming team.
item.title: Shayna Jack vows to clear name at doping appeal

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Theme parks and cinema operator Village Roadshow has agreed to exclusive negotiations with private equity firm BGH after a caveat-heavy offer of up to $468.5 million.
item.title: Village Roadshow agrees to takeover talks with BGH

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The wide-ranging funding will include an obligation for construction businesses to hire Victorians who have lost their jobs due to the pandemic.
item.title: Andrews reveals $2.7b for building blitz, including $1.1b for schools

item.description: Japan is on course for its deepest postwar slump as the coronavirus crisis takes a heavy toll on businesses and consumers
item.title: Japan falls into 'full-blown recession', worst yet to come as pandemic wreaks havoc

item.description: In 1946, an international conference discussed how to enable an instantaneous exchange of global weather information through a complicated exchange of facsimile weather maps.
item.title: From the Archives, 1946: Forecasting the world's weather

item.description: Netanyahu and his former rival Benny Gantz both hailed their "emergency government of national unity" as the end of an unprecedented political crisis.
item.title: Israeli new government forms, ending 17-month deadlock

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Police use drones to help search bushland east of Melbourne as part of an investigation into the suspicious disappearance of Dalibor 'Dale' Pantic.
item.title: Cops scour bush for 'great dad' who was 'fairly significant' drug dealer

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Temporary car parking will be set up at Moore Park and six kilometres of pop-up cycleways rolled out across Sydney as capacity on trains, buses and ferries is slashed.
item.title: Capacity slashed in Sydney coronavirus public transport overhaul
